intro: Pavonia undulata, commonly known as the zigzag hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, undulating leaf margins. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically blooming from late spring to early fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its adaptability and vibrant blooms make it a valuable addition to native plant landscapes.
